title: Reflected XSS in Search Function via searchFor Parameter on testphp.vulnweb.com
vulnerability_information:
## Summary The search functionality at `http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query` is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting. When a user submits a search via POST request, the `searchFor` parameter value is reflected directly in the response HTML without sanitization. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Navigate to `http://testphp.vulnweb.com/` 2. Locate the search form on the page 3. Enter the following XSS payload in the search field: `` 4. Click the 'go' button to submit the search 5. Observe that an alert box appears showing the domain name, confirming JavaScript execution Alternatively, send this HTTP request directly: ``` POST /search.php?test=query HTTP/1.1 Host: testphp.vulnweb.com Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded searchFor=&goButton=go ``` The response contains: ```html

searched for:

``` The payload is reflected without any encoding or sanitization. ## Impact An attacker can craft a malicious form that auto-submits to the search endpoint, causing arbitrary JavaScript execution in the victim's browser. This enables session hijacking, cookie theft, and phishing.
